body: Ok, I have done a functional test.

@peng-yongsheng @Liu-XinYuan This PR broke the core feature of the collector. You must test before your PR. I will submit PR to reverse this PR. Next time, you must provide test report before merging.
Closing, no test report provided. I am assuming not working.
Provided.

Coverage increased (+0.1%) to 12.302% when pulling **da6252ffe2d974494254aa51c71113c576072971 on peng-yongsheng:fixed/zk_-cluster** into **7214329e0ad8846eb25b1186a0d7423191080ebb on apache:master**.
Fixed in #1841

We can propagate skywalking internal info across threads and processes. But that mechanism is not open to end user in default. Business info propagation is very dangerous, in many cases, they cause memory leak, network traffic disaster. 

You could change our codes to supports that, but I wouldn't recommend to do that.

> I think it will be released along with the upcoming Dubbo v2.6.5.

@chickenlj Great to know. @IcebergXTY When you have time, please help to test SkyWalking on their incoming 2.6.5, then provide the feedback here.
ok, thank you
Does the apm-toolkit-trace-activation project implementation the feature which propagate skywalking internal info across threads and processes ?

> you mean the apm-toolkit-trace-activation project implementation the feature which propagate skywalking internal info across threads and processes?

No. There no official API could do the propagation like you said.
I know, you said "We can propagate skywalking internal info across threads and processes", I am reading the source, so I want to know which project or class implement the feature you said. thank you

> "We can propagate skywalking internal info across threads and processes

This means `#inject`, `#extract`, `#capture` and `#continued` in TracingContext.
Thank you.

1. Is there any async process mode?

You need to use remote debug to find out why plugin doesn't work.

English only in issue.

> org.apache.skywalking.apm.agent.core.remote.TraceSegmentServiceClient.boot()? can i largen this 
TraceSegmentServiceClientboot70carrier.consume(this, 1); 1

Because too many threads mean high payload to the agent, you CPU will cost more. 

> 2In my agent log file skywalking.log debug a lot of DEBUG 2018-10-29 09:25:46 TraceSegmentServiceClient : One trace segment has been abandoned, cause by buffer is full. 
How can i optimize configured agenttrace segment buffer

That means your backend is not powerful enough. Buffer is not for saving these segments forever.

> 3WARN More than 300 spans required to create can i configured 1000300spans1000

If you have such segment including 1000 spans, you could. Otherwise, I would say, you have span leak.Some plugin or something is not working well.
does the ver 5.0.0-GA support oracle    im not found the oracle-plugin

From supported list, https://github.com/apache/incubator-skywalking/blob/master/docs/en/setup/service-agent/java-agent/Supported-list.md , we are not supported yet.

@ascrutae Any interest to support that? I think this is a very important plugin.
Thanks!

I found another problem. When I started the service and entered the console, I was prompted with the following error.
![skywalking](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/5615719/47899191-b8752f80-deb3-11e8-82b1-fe8160a9fdd0.png)
Because of the first issue, you backend starts up failure. So UI is meaningless.

I just download and run the release on my laptop, nothing wrong. If you are in windows, please make sure you unzip file right. We have received a lot times, windows block unzip with long file path or file name, so you will miss some jar file. Check your collector-libs folder, should have 159 jar files in it.

I have tested it in the CentOS environment and found the same problem in the logs.

![skywalking](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/5615719/47900040-7ac5d600-deb6-11e8-9632-74cc459d3f82.png)

[root@dev /home/apache-skywalking-apm-incubating]# cd collector-libs/
[root@dev /home/apache-skywalking-apm-incubating/collector-libs]#  ls -l | grep "^-" | wc -l
159

This interface has been implmented in `org.apache.skywalking.apm.collector.storage.es.StorageModuleEsProvider#prepare`

> this.registerServiceImplementation(ITTLConfigService.class, new TTLConfigService(config));

Due to stand-alone deployment, I chose to use H2DB
![skywalking](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/5615719/47900626-78fd1200-deb8-11e8-9a0f-3d9b839a7dd0.png)
You should read the document. H2 storage is not provided in 5.x. No one contributes that feature.
Ok, then let me build the ES service, thank you!
Switch to 5.x branch or 5.0.0-GA tag, You will find the code.
That is a new error. Source codes have been built and checked by many people during releasing process in ASF.
Ok,fixed this immediately plz.

I built code from github.com,tag is 5.x ,got new error:
**org.apache.skywalking.apm.network.proto** does not exists.
I cannot find it from maven or github.
No. You don't following document. Download from github is wrong. Download from Apache website or git clone.

Got it,thanks!
